page.title: 07POST-WAR HOUSES IN BECKLEY
page.content: In the High Street two pairs of Council houses were built just after the War. These have now been purchased by their occupiers. Two sets of one or two bed- roomed bungalows have been built for older people, one of four dwellings in High Street and a more recent row of five dwellings named Roman Way at the village end of the Woodperry Road. As Beckley is in the Oxford Green Belt most house building since the war has been permitted only between existing houses so that Woodperry Road now consists of a continuous row of dwellings, mostly detatched, on the N.W. side of the road. In the 1970s eleven houses were built in Beckley Court, formerly a stone quarry. Most of the Beckley children at the village school live in Woodperry Road or Beckley Court.
